import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.patches import Polygon
import random

fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))

x = [0, 10, 10, 0, 0]
y = [0, 0, 10, 10, 0]

ax.fill(x, y, color='#312E8F')

ax.set_xlim(0, 10)
ax.set_ylim(0, 5)
ax.axis('off') 

ax.set_xlim(0, 10)
ax.set_ylim(0, 5)
ax.axis('off')

ax.set_facecolor('#000000')

def create_mountain(ax, base_x, base_y, width, height, num_triangles, color_range):
    for _ in range(num_triangles):
        x1 = base_x + random.uniform(0, width)
        x2 = base_x + random.uniform(0, width)
        peak_x = base_x + random.uniform(0, width)
        peak_y = base_y + height * random.uniform(0.5, 1)
        triangle = Polygon([[x1, base_y], [x2, base_y], [peak_x, peak_y]], closed=True, 
                           color=(random.uniform(*color_range), 0.4, 0.7))
        ax.add_patch(triangle)

create_mountain(ax, -1, 0, 6, 5, 100, (0.0, 0.4)) 
create_mountain(ax, 3, 0, 6, 5, 100, (0.0, 0.4))  
create_mountain(ax, 7, 0, 6, 5, 100, (0.0, 0.4))

create_mountain(ax, -1, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.85, 1.0)) 
create_mountain(ax, 3, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.85, 1.0))  
create_mountain(ax, 7, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.85, 1.0))

create_mountain(ax, -1, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.55, 0.85))  
create_mountain(ax, 3, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.55, 0.85))
create_mountain(ax, 7, 0, 6, 4, 100, (0.55, 0.85))

plt.show()
